nl.strohalm.cyclos.utils.statistics

Class ListOperations

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.strohalm.cyclos.utils.statistics.ListOperations

  • public final class ListOperations
extends java.lang.Object
    Class provides additional usefull list methods. It works like the standard general Math class: it has only static methods, and is final.
    Author:
    Rinke

      static double getElementFromIndex(java.util.List<java.lang.Number> list, double index)
      gets the "element" belonging to an index from a List with Numbers, where the index can even be a broken (non-int) number, and where balanced correction is applied

      • getElementFromIndex

        public static double getElementFromIndex(java.util.List<java.lang.Number> list,
                         double index)
        gets the "element" belonging to an index from a List with Numbers, where the index can even be a broken (non-int) number, and where balanced correction is applied

      • getMax

        public static java.lang.Number getMax(java.util.List<java.lang.Number> list)

        Returns:
        null if the list was null or empty.

      • getSecondFromPairCollection

        public static <S,T> java.util.List<T> getSecondFromPairCollection(java.util.Collection<Pair<S,T>> collection)
        takes the second elements of a Collection of Pairs, and returns them in a List
        Type Parameters:
        S - the type of the frist element of the Pairs in the input collection
        T - the type of the second element of the Pairs in the input collection
        Parameters:
        collection - the input Collection with Pairs
        Returns:
        a List with only the second elements of the Pairs.

      • getSecondNumberFromPairCollection

        public static <S,T extends java.lang.Number> java.util.List<java.lang.Number> getSecondNumberFromPairCollection(java.util.Collection<Pair<S,T>> collection)
        takes the second elements of a Collection of Pairs, and returns them in a List. Same as getSecondFromPairCollection, but returns a List, where getSecondFromPairList returns the type of second element of the Pair
        Type Parameters:
        S - the type of the first element of the Pairs in the input collection
        T - the type of the second element of the Pairs in the input collection, must extend Number.
        Parameters:
        collection - the input Collection with Pairs
        Returns:
        a List with only the second elements of the Pairs.

        Make an array with doubles from a List
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • listToIntArray

        public static int[] listToIntArray(java.util.List<java.lang.Number> list)
        Make an array with ints from a List
        Parameters:
        list - a list with Numbers
        Returns:
        an array with ints.

      • transposeMatrix

        public static <T> T[][] transposeMatrix(T[][] matrix)
        switches x and y of a matrix (= a 2 dimensional array), so that matrix[2][3] will become matrix[3][2]. Returns null when the size of first dimension is 0.
